REGRANS broken-stick regression method

Source: R/regrans.R
regrans_fun.Rd

REGRANS broken-stick regression method

Usage

regrans_fun(
  x,
  y,
  min_changept = min(x, na.rm = TRUE),
  max_changept = max(x, na.rm = TRUE),
  n_tries = 100
)

Arguments

x

Integer or double vector of measurements for the x-axis variable (e.g., carapace width).

y

Integer or double vector of measurements for the y-axis variable (e.g., claw height).

min_changept

Integer or double; the lower bound for possible SM50 values. Must be on the same scale of the data. Defaults to the minimum value of the x-variable.

max_changept

Integer or double; the upper bound for possible SM50 values. Must be on the same scale of the data. Defaults to the maximum value of the x-variable.

n_tries

Number of breakpoints to test within the unknown range.

Value

Data frame with breakpoints tested and their sum of squares

Examples

fc <- fake_crabs(n=100, allo_params=c(1, 0.2, 1.1, 0.2))
regrans_fun(fc$x, fc$y)
#>      changept   sum_sq
